messages.text: For anyone interested in nonlinear optimal control, there's a stub tutorial showing what can be done in ModelingToolkit right now: <https://mtk.sciml.ai/dev/tutorials/nonlinear_optimal_control/>. You can see where we are going if you look at the acausal modeling tutorial: <https://mtk.sciml.ai/dev/tutorials/acausal_components/> . We plan to get similar interfaces together to make it easy to specify the variables and get the solutions as time series, along with symbolic simplification of the generated optimization problems. But it should be pretty clear what the near future looks like!

I've had a look at ControlSystems internals and i've noticed that the implementations could allow for more thoughput.
The package doesn't use Static Arrays where it could, it doesn't create a block diagonal for the A of the sum of two state space systems.

Has anyone encountered performance problems with ControlSystems?
We have the type `HeteroStateSpace` that accepts arbitrary matrix types, I use this with static arrays

messages.text: Has anyone ever worked with large enough systems that ControlSystems became a serious bottleneck of the workflow?
Sure, it becomes the bottleneck already for small systems if you close an optimization loop around, e.g., freqresp or lsim etc.
